intro: Erodium neilreichii var. hoefftianum, commonly known as the Hoefftianum bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb with small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender stems and hairy leaves, typical of the Geraniaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
